DataElement.preferredName: Brief Appraisal Inventory 4 How Often Did You Think About Impressions and Assumptions Others Have About You Because of Your Health Score 7 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation about how often they think about impressions and assumptions that others have about them because of their health, using a 7 point Likert Scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Brief Appraisal Inventory How Often Did You Think About Impressions and Assumptions Others Have About You Because of Your Health Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to account for quality-of-life issues and assess their impact on responses in patient-reported outcome surveys._A question about the frequency that a person thought about a particular thing._A question about how often a person thought about impressions and assumptions that others have about them because of their health._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Impressions and assumptions t
ReferenceDocuments.description: Impressions and assumptions that others have about you because of your health.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: BAI: Brief Appraisal Inventory; Rapkin, B.D. et al.; Qual Life Res (2018)
